headline: 'The Five' on Pelosi slamming media for not selling Biden agenda

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: It's not exciting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hi. I'm Greg Gutfeld with Judge Jeanine Pirro, Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters and if you lock your keys in the car, she can squeeze between the weather stripping, Dana Perino. THE FIVE. President Biden finally addressing the supply chain jam that threatens to royal, yes, royal the holiday season. And also, Jesse, Jr.'s Christmas gifts. I know it's terrible. It comes amid a slew of bad headlines showing Joe's metamorphosis into Jimmy Carter is almost complete. Americans are quitting their jobs at a record pace, 4.3 million left their posts in August. Inflation surging more than expected in September with consumers paying 5.4 percent more for goods compared to last year. And the White House is warning shoppers their stockings are going to look empty. Not mine. Outright saying there will be things that people can't get. Here's the president.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: The port of Los Angeles announced today that it's going to begin operating 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Today's announcement has the potential to be a game changer. FedEx and UPS, two of our nation's biggest freight movers are committing today to significantly increase the amount of goods they're moving at night, but now we need the rest of the private sector chain to step up as well. This is not called a supply chain for nothing. One of the reasons why I think it's very important that we get the infrastructure plan passed. We've seen the cost of inaction in the pandemic, in the delays, in the congestion that affect every American.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Can this administration guarantee that holiday packages will arrive on time?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: We are not the Postal Service or UPS or FedEx. We cannot guarantee. What we can do is use every lever at the federal government disposal to reduce delays to ensure that we are addressing bottle next in the system.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a chocolate bar.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: It's a cocaine joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's a chocolate bar. It's a Cadbury chocolate bar. So, Dana when you hear about, it always comes down to now it's up to us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The government, we've already -- it's not really our fault.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They build it, the president speech today, is the president is going to take action and then the action is that you are the problem. Like do you honestly think that there are any retailers or business people in America who don't want to sell stuff?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Of course, they do. And people, do you think the truck drivers don't want to get paid? Do you think the people -- the problems have been building for a long time? It takes about six months for one of these things to deal with it. So, Jesse Jr. might get his gift on Easter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: At this rate and, you know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He won't care. tell him it's Christmas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He'd be grateful. I also believe that we could actually -- we could have a segment on THE FIVE reading with a dramatic interpretation the chief of staff retweets and tweets about how great it is that unemployment is at 5 percent and this is great because now people are going to get paid more to do things.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, however, sorry. Employers spent the last six months competing with the federal government for -- of enhanced unemployment, the benefits for the workers. They reduced their businesses. They cut their hours. They served fewer customers. You think that they don't want -- of course they do. And maybe there are structural things that happened in the economy but what also has happened is the inflation. So, CNBC called it today a two percent pay cut for people in America. So, you can pay more but that means that people are also paying more at the grocery store, at the pump. It will be a dark holiday season. I saw one funny cartoon with Santa telling a little kid, sorry, we're also out of coal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You just bring up a great point. Judge, coal that creates energy, the Dems are saying, they're promising everything is going to get to every -- how does everything -- how this stuff get moved? It's fuel. It's fuel, which is like --

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's like, but what we're saying maybe is a premonition or a foreshadowing of what happens in the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is what we should be getting used to.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right, right. Get used to the fact that you're not going to be able to get anything you used to get --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: -- because we're now part of this new climate change, new green deal, --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: -- you're not going to have anything. But what I love about this story the most is the ability of the White House to deflect. You know, while inflation is rising, wage earners aren't making more money, more people are quitting because they can make more money staying at home. This is all the White House's problem and Donald trump predicted this last year. He said, this was going to happen. And, by the way, who's the genius who just figured out, you know, we can get more done if we work seven days a week, 24/7. Are you stupid? I mean, really.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So, this is what I think the problem is. I think people don't want to work. They're not getting paid to work. They think that there's a benefit at the end if they don't work, and the people who want to work can't get the jobs that they want to get.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Geraldo, I went and called BMW. Seems that your mini will not be arriving for at least another seven months.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm glad you brought it up, because my 16-year-old is driving, I'm very nervous about that but she's excellent. Here's my point and I think this helps solve this whole dilemma. Unions have to listen to what I'm about to say. Come on board. Why do you have to be 21 years of age to drive these big rigs? Why not 18? Why not -- the hardest thing to do is employ inner city kids from 18 to 21. They graduate high school then you have to keep them legal until they can become a member of the police force or something like that. It's very, very difficult. Eighteen to 21 let them be our drivers. They can pass these tests. It enormously increases the pool of available drivers and that I submit, it's not the ships, it's the trucks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's why those containers are sitting on those docks --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- and there's no one to drive them. Let the kids do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hey, that was on America's Newsroom this morning.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It was?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: High school student and professor. Yes, he's 18 years old, he's like I think I can have a career.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Great. Great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But aren't they even talking about relaxing the requirements to be a commercial truck driver?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I mean, they should probably get to that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, that one you could relax.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I could never drive a truck.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And there's one more thing more controversial, if I may.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's hard to reach the pedals.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The Mexicans are great drivers. I just came back from Mexico, they're everywhere. Give temporary visas until my 18 to 21 plan comes into effect, give the Mexican drivers temporary, temporary, underline temporary visas and let them drive domestically in the United States to help.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was not on this room.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You did not say Mexicans are great drivers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. I mean, --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're bringing -- they're bringing the best drivers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It can be true that they are great drivers.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: This is the Geraldo plan. Good plan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's not just the truck drivers, Geraldo. Look around the table. Where is this made?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: China. China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Where's this made?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: China, China, China, China.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Everything around here is made in China. Now whose fault is that? It's Joe Biden and his buddies made sure that after the Cold War they brought all the factories from here all the way to China and East Asia. So now the American destiny is tied to China's destiny. That's how we have a pandemic. That's how we have a supply chain problem. That's why Jesse Jr. is not going to get anything for Christmas. I'm sorry, Jesse Jr., it's China's fault and Joe Biden's fault.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Have you talked to him about this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. But I hope he's not watching for many, many reasons. And Joe Biden had a great opportunity to do this, after the lab leak he could have been inaugurated and say guys we're going to make you pay the price, we're going to incentivize all these companies to remove these factories, bring them here, bring them to the western hemisphere, even if they're in our hemisphere. The shipping lanes are much quicker and much easier and just go south to north. But, no, no, no. Imagine what the supply chain problem is going to look like if Taiwan blows up or the Chinese real estate bubble blows up or the next variant sweeps through that country. It's going to be a mess. You're going to order stuff off Amazon. It's never going to get here. You're going to have to build your own furniture. Do you want to sit in furniture I built?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not. I don't even want to do that. So, he goes out there today and says, you know what, I'm going to call some companies so they can hire more drivers and then at the same sense he says, we need to go green.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: More truckers, make this a green economy, it doesn't make any sense. I could imagine Donald Trump if this had happened under his watch, he would have had in the Oval, he would have had the head of the trucking union guy, he would have had the shipping magnates there and he would have had a whole conversation, gotten some consensus there and said this is what we're going to do. Let's see it happens.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It would have been great, just say your name, introduce yourself.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You remember what we used to do?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just around the table.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. And now Joe said he called someone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Steve Apple.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I just want to mention one other thing. The president has not had a cabinet meeting since July 20th.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: What I a shock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No time like the present.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Such a boring group.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. All right. Up next, Nancy Pelosi blames the media for the backlash to the Democrats radical agenda.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Democrats are getting upset that Americans aren't buying into their massive radical spending bills. So, are they looking inward and asking themselves why their agenda is so unpopular? Of course not. Nancy Pelosi yesterday went after the media, blasting them for not doing the Democrats' job in trying to convince the American people to support the radical proposals.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Do you think you need to do a better job at messaging and, going forward, how do you sell this if ultimately you have to --

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI (D), UNITED STATES SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think you all could do a better job selling it to be very frank with you because every time I come here I go through the list, family medical leave, climate -- the issues that are in there. But it is true. It is hard to break through when you have such a comprehensive package.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it's really interesting. Obviously, Republicans have reason to say that the media is bias, but if you ask a lot of Democrats, they think the media is bias against them as well. Hillary Clinton for sure will tell you that. When it comes to the New York Times and remember the Clinton global initiative, they broke that story all the e-mails, that kind of thing. So, I would always just recommend this. If you're in the private sector and you have to hire a P.R. person, always hire a Republican. They've definitely had to work harder, they don't think anybody is going to be handed to them, they have to be more persuasive in their language and more precise in their -- on the merits. Notice that we have not seen the text of this bill? And there's a good reason for that, because as soon as you start looking into it, people are saying, wait, we don't really like this. It's not a benign issue.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All the polls are saying, no, we don't really think we need this, we don't think it will help us. And so, they have an uphill battle. I just want to mention a couple things that are in here. Just to be clear for people. You need to talk about free child care? One of the things that they would do is gift this gift to the unions and they would require all pre- kindergarten providers to have a college degree.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you think that that will reduce the cost of child care in America?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We already have a child care crisis. And they're demanding like how much they're going to get paid? There are already not enough child care providers.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And do you need a college degree?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: College graduate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You just don't need to have it. The other thing is, it would block faith based child care providers from participating in the program.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that is wrong so that is where you get the culture war stuff into these bills.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They don't have the text, but pay attention to it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK. So, Geraldo, she says only 10 percent know about what's in the bill, and --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think that's an exaggeration.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But you -- let me finish, let me finish. Yes, I do, too. But she says, but if they knew what was in the bill, she's convinced Americans would support it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Let's take the example that Dana makes about the pre-K. What is pre-K? I mean, I'm all for it, you get the kid and you want them to, you know, evolve as much as possible and be as ready for kindergarten as possible. Pre-K basically is day care, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, in reality. So, when you insist that someone has a degree, a four-year degree to baby-sit your kid, of course it's going to just, you know, lard expense on -- an idea, you want pre-K, universal pre K, great. But to have a college degree unnecessary. I mean, none of my kids ever had, you know, that person.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And they grew up fine and went to great schools, and you know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not everybody has to go to college.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And that's the other thing, not everybody has to go to college.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And one thing I just want to say in my symbolic role here as progressive, I think that -- don't you think that Sinema and Manchin have to be more specific about what they want in --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK. And that --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- and what they want out rather than making people guess about what -- I think.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They said they've been very clear.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's very unfair.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I was going to ask Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Will Manchin and Sinema fold or will they -- will they stick to their guns?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't know. I just think, I want to go back to what Pelosi said about the media because it's amazing that you can say that with a straight face but that's the advances of modern medicine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it her fault to expect them to carry the water? I don't think it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She looks although the media the way you look at that friend that promises to help you move a sofa, and this is a huge, massive sofa, and they have just given up trying to move it for her. And she's like, come on you promised you were going to move this up the stairs. She looked at the media in a way that, you know, they're in the same club. She's kind of right. She's kind of right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: She is right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I do have to say she doesn't bother to hide her assumption of superiority. She really does see everybody else around her as like non- playing characters in a video game.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like she's playing the game and everybody else there is just there to deal with her.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK. Jesse, AOC is actually warning Schumer and Pelosi saying you can't get rid of this, this and this so it looks like the progressives are at war with some of the mainstream Democrats there. I mean, she's basically threatening them. Is she the leader of -- the Speaker of the House?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, she's got a lot of juice, judge, and you know the progressives outnumber the moderates so she might be a leader in some regards. And the reason that the media doesn't want to cover the details of this thing because they know if they do no one is going to want it. Because look at these details. Twenty-five million for butterflies. What do they need money for? How about eight billion for climate police.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I thought they want to defund the police. Not the climate police. How about illegal aliens get free college tuition, $643 million for culturally appropriate foods.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What is that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) at schools.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Taco Tuesday? Equity, eight million illegals get amnesty or they're going to fix racist roads and bridges, that probably just means they get to demolish statues that they don't like. Also, millions in grants for organizations that treat individuals suffering from loneliness, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Wow. Tell them to watch THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: From loneliness now, people that are lonely get millions of dollars and it penalizes marriage --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's terrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- among crushing taxes for small business.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're welcome, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Coming up, the Biden administration defending their plan for the IRS. This gets even better, to snoop around in your bank accounts.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Big money.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Treasury Secretary Janey Yellen is trying to convince Americans that that really isn't spying.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Does this mean that the government is trying to peek into our pocketbooks if you want to look --

utterances.speaker: JANET YELLEN, U.S. TREASURY SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Absolutely --

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: -- at $600 transactions?

utterances.speaker: YELLEN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not. The proposal involves no reporting of individual transactions. We have a tax gap that over the next decade it's estimated that $7 trillion, namely a shortfall in the amount that IRS is collecting due to a failure of individuals to report the income that they've earned.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Who was it who sat before Congress who said no, the NSA doesn't spy on us and then his eyes look left --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Clapper.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: -- he said not witting -- James Clapper. Not wittingly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I hate it when people lie to me. I actually wrote a book called "Don't Lie To Me." Ok? Here's the problem with what's her name, Janet Yellen. She says it involves no reporting of individual transactions. We are not spying but there's a shortfall, a tax gap, a failure of some to report income. There is a tax fraud. So, we're going to require banks to report every customer transaction over 600. She is lying to you. They are spying on you, $600 or more. Now the bank is now an agent of the IRS. OK?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that's the point Geraldo, you can't have the banks deputized by the feds to snoop --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- on American citizens

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, we have that now. Let's remember that bank --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not like this.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No. But my point is, the banks have been empowered and required to report transactions of $10,000 or more.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Why? Because of dope dealers, you know, all the cash business. So, you get your stack of cash, you cash you write a check, you're laundering the money, the banks can see that illicit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But that's a lot different than $600.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No. It's a huge difference.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, many people don't let their spouse look at their checkbook.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And to have the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Many people including you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- IRS and the bank -- not me, my wife controls all our finances.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: She does?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's not a good idea, Geraldo, especially with your finances.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: At my age.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, Yellen is not -- she doesn't have great P.R. right now. They put her out there, they tried to make this thing look OK and I don't think she did a very good job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, the other thing is, is that they are going --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: She did a terrible job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- I believe that they will drop this provision --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I do, too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- before they ever actually pass it so they're taking on all of this water and negative press for a reason that -- for no reason really in the end.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that makes it really bad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: However, however, you know who this is really affecting? Young people who use Venmo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Right? I didn't think of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right? And like baby sitters and things like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And all of sudden, like wait, are you going to -- because it's income. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's adorable.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's pretty cute. I mean, you can't even get mad at them. You can't even shoo them away.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No. Come on. They may do it. No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's on a loop, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's in a loop.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Your turn. Your turn.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, it's my turn? OK, all right. Everybody loves a warm cup of Joe's from Starbucks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not me.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I actually don't go to Starbucks. I go -- I go to Dunkin Donuts. But anyway, take a look. Here is a dog, a 12-week-old Rottweiler. And this is an adorable moment. He -- for the first time, Chico, this Rottweiler, is trying his very first puppuccino. The puppuccino is a mix of water and whipped cream. Now, while owners should be careful how much dairy they give their dogs, an occasional puppuccino is considered safe. And not only is it safe for all you dog lovers, it's free.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where's it free?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Are you listening?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I wasn't. I was --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK, well, then you need to focus. At Starbucks.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I thought it's Dunkin Donuts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, Starbucks now serves dog?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. We gave Rookie a puppuccino.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Starbucks --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I thought that was illegal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He did a William Shatner everywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thinking he would cause a bit of a mess.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK, but it's a -- it's free.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: There is no pumpkin shortage in Westchester County, your County.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: My grandchildren, this is Geraldo's these are my little pumpkins news with Geraldo. And here are my little pumpkins. That's Liam and Ella. She's six. He's four. In the back is JC. He's the big boy. In a couple of weeks, he'll be nine years old. They're at Stewart's Fruit Farm in Yorktown Heights in Westchester. There's is plenty of pumpkins and the kids are having a bowl. And you know, the seasons are so vivid. That's the one thing you love about living --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do ever (INAUDIBLE) for great pumpkin, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In a bathroom in Berlin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. He was out of --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's a -- that's a real story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a terrible --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And I am not going to tell you what happened.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just tell us what happened.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not going to tell you because he was naughty.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: With Elvis or with the pumpkins?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: About the pumpkins? No, he's talking about the Elvis Costello in the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just tell the story, Geraldo. We have 30 seconds.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You have 30 seconds.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No, he's a very cool guy. He just wanted to hang out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In the bathroom?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Not in men's room particularly. But he was also very humble. I mean for most crazy rockers, you think -- why are you laughing? You told me to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Now the audience is going to be --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're not telling us what happened at the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The audience is going to be -- we left the bathroom and hung out.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Where?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We're in Berlin.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You said, you got to hear what happened. And that's what happened?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was a hell of a story. That's it for us. "SPECIAL REPORT" is up next. Hey, Bret. Content and Programming Copyright 2021 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
